alert.note: Alert for Hampden (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 6:08PM EDT until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Connecticut... Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hampden and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Hartford and Middlesex Counties. For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Northampton, Holyoke Dam, Holyoke, Springfield, Thompsonville, Hartford, Middle Haddam... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Thompsonville. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Significant and widespread flooding along the river can be expected from the Massachusetts towns of Agawam and Longmeadow, through the northern Connecticut towns of Suffield and Enfield. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight and continue rising to a crest of 17.7 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.8 feet on 03/15/1977. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 615 AM EDT.
